title: From Isolation to Involvement: Adapting Machine Creativity Software to Support Human-Computer Co-Creation

author: Anna Kantosalo, Department of Computer Science, University of Helsinki

segmentation: Hello, thank you for the interaction.
I'm here today to talk about how to adapt machine creativity methods into supporting human computer Co creation.
This is a very important topic for this audience as the field of computational creativity measures we have to think about how to apply the research we've done into real world contexts.
Our approach is to look into three existing cases or adapting computational methodology.
Injure Co creation creative software and then conduct our own case study to add more details to it.
The most ambitious vision of human computer interaction for creativity involves a real partnership in which humans and computers work hand in hand.
This quote by Todd Lubat highlights the interesting part of our research.
Which is.
True software that can enhance the creative abilities of both the human as well as the computer.
Today I'm going to give you a short background introduction.
Then in an introduction to our methods and present the cases we studied.
Then I'm going to give you an overview of our own case and the results related to that, and finally move on to a conclusion.
